words.source: H3947 laqach, Qal wayyiqtol 3fs; KJV 'Then … took', ESV 'Then … took', NASB 'Then … took'
H6855 Tsipporah, proper noun feminine; KJV/ESV/NASB 'Zipporah'
H6864 tsor, noun ms; KJV 'a sharp stone', ESV 'a flint', NASB 'a flint' — a sharpened stone knife, used for circumcision as in Josh 5:2-3
H3772 karath, Qal wayyiqtol 3fs; KJV 'and cut off', ESV 'and cut off', NASB 'and cut off'
H853 ʾeth, direct object marker; not translated in KJV/ESV/NASB
H6190 ʿorlah, noun fs construct; KJV 'the foreskin', ESV 'her son's foreskin', NASB 'her son's foreskin'
H1121 ben, noun ms + 3fs suffix; KJV 'of her son', ESV 'her son's', NASB 'her son's'
H5060 nagaʿ, Hiphil wayyiqtol 3fs; KJV 'and cast it', ESV 'and touched', NASB 'and threw it' — DEBATED: nagaʿ can mean 'touch' or 'cast/throw'; translations diverge

H7272 regel, noun fd + preposition le + 3ms suffix; KJV 'at his feet', ESV 'Moses' feet', NASB 'at his feet' — DEBATED: 'his' may refer to Moses, the son, or even the angel of YHWH; 'feet' is sometimes a euphemism
H559 ʾamar, Qal wayyiqtol 3fs; KJV 'and said', ESV 'and said', NASB 'and she said'
H3588 ki, conjunction (asseverative); KJV 'Surely', ESV 'Surely', NASB 'You are indeed' — ki here used emphatically, not causally

H2860 chathan, noun ms construct; KJV 'a bloody husband', ESV 'a bridegroom of blood', NASB 'a bridegroom of blood' — UNCERTAIN: H2860 chathan means 'bridegroom' or 'son-in-law'; KJV renders as 'husband'; heavily debated passage
H1818 dam, noun mp (plural of intensity); KJV 'bloody', ESV 'of blood', NASB 'of blood' — plural damim suggests bloodshed or blood-rite
H859 ʾattah, independent pronoun 2ms; KJV 'art thou', ESV 'you are', NASB 'you are'
Preposition le + 1cs suffix; KJV 'to me', ESV 'to me', NASB 'to me'
